question: One of the departments of the 1993 Bolivian general election features a lake next to mountain peaks covered in snow - in what year did this department become the capital of Bolivia?
context: In 1898, La Paz was made the de facto seat of the national government, with Sucre remaining the nominal historical as well as judiciary capital. This change reflected the shift of the Bolivian economy away from the largely exhausted silver mines of Potosí to the exploitation of tin near Oruro, and resulting shifts in the distribution of economic and political power among various national elites.
